page.title: 10Brands Hatch Place
page.content:
{Brands Hatch Place}lies just half a mile from the east entrance to Brands Hatch. Bought to be run as a{hotel some{ten years ago,}its growth and development have been somewhat unusual.
It is not a hotel but a{country club. This is due to some quirk of the {licencing laws.}The{Georgian house, built in 1806 for the Duke of Norfolk, has been restored to its former glory, with a delightful{conservatory. At Grand Prix times it is overflowing.
As an adjunct of the country club, a separate{health and fitness centre}has been built in the old stable block, offering swimming, squash, sauna, solarium, jacuzzi, gymnasium and snooker.{Local membership}is available for{Â£120 per person per annum.
